kernfrasen: wise grandmother talking to an adolescent boy
God is Father, Son, and Holy Spirit
learned love from my mother and father
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: GOD IS THE ARCHETYPAL PARENT / AGAPE IS KINSHIP CARE

kernfrasen: long and weary way through all the levels of Hell
ravaged face untouched by plastic surgery

cognitieve_implicaties: Abstract love is invisible and therefore non-existent to the human mind.
theologische_implicaties: Christology is the only lens through which Agape is visible.
ethische_implicaties: Believers must become the 'face' of love for others.
onbedoelde_consequenties: Potential to limit God's love to human-like expressions only.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher re-activates the 'face' metaphor by contrasting it with the 'ravaged' face of Jeanne Moreau and the 'plastic surgery' of modern culture.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The sermon maintains a tight focus on the distinction between Eros (Passion) and Agape (Love), using the 'Face' as the unifying image that bridges human experience and divine reality.

succesvolle_blending.locatie: The description of the elderly woman/housekeeper
succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The preacher blends the mundane tasks of a housekeeper (changing sheets) with the cosmic agency of God (agent and instrument).

sterktes.beschrijving: Takes the 'dead' metaphor of 1 Cor 13 (often sentimentalized) and makes it 'heavy' and 'severe' through the contrast with Mike Wallace's superficiality.
sterktes.voorbeeld: If I stay up all night working on a sermon... but have not agape, I might as well be a bag of wind.

risicos.beschrijving: By focusing heavily on parental care (wiping tears, changing sheets), the 'wrath' or 'holiness' of God might be obscured.
risicos.voorbeeld: He will hear your cries in the night and wipe away your tears.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation may view God solely as a cosmic caregiver rather than a sovereign judge.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: The 60 Minutes interview set (Mike Wallace vs. Jeanne Moreau).
sub_worlds: The domestic space of caretaking (changing sheets/nursing)

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: Seamlessly links the 'childish ways' of the interview to the 'childish ways' of the text.

versterkte_schemas.schema_naam: God as the Source of Love
versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Repeatedly stating that Agape is not a human capacity but a gift from beyond.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Using the 'ravaged' face of an aging star to show the failure of passion.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Fits the Epiphany theme of 'manifestation'—showing the face of God.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the Relational/Familial domain, specifically focusing on the 'Face' as a container for identity and love. It successfully avoids the Economic domain (transactional grace), which is rare for a sermon on 'worth' and 'sacrifice.'

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Connect the 'noise' to modern digital distractions or the 'bag of wind' mentioned earlier.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: A feedback loop in a sound system that hurts the ears but says nothing.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The shift from the 'ravaged face' (physical) to 'God's love has a face' (metaphorical).
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Explicitly link the 'scars' of Moreau to the 'wounds' of Christ to bridge the physical/spiritual gap.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: If love must have a face, is God unloving when He is silent or 'hidden'?
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Briefly acknowledge the 'mirror dimly' as the limit of the face metaphor.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To emphasize the 'constancy' Moreau mentions, using 'Foundation' or 'Bedrock' metaphors.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using a contemporary cultural artifact (the interview) to deconstruct a dead metaphor and replace it with a living, embodied theological schema.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: While an aesthetic analysis would praise the 'rolling waves' of the prose, CMT reveals that the 'waves' are actually cognitive mappings of 'Love as a Force'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's focus on the 'experience' of the listener, CMT shows how the preacher re-wires the listener's conceptual hardware regarding 'Passion'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT identifies that the preacher uses 'Verticality' (Dante's levels) to establish the 'Transcendence' of love before bringing it down to the 'Horizontal' level of changing bedsheets.

appendices.notities: The preacher uses Shakespeare and Dante not as mere 'quotes' but as secondary source domains to reinforce the 'Constancy' and 'Journey' metaphors.
